page.title: 15Wellworthy Ltd. 2
page.content: The manual employees work a 39 hour week whilst the 'white collar' workers do a 37\ hour week.Most of the workers are local with about 80 from the Isle of Wight. They also employ Spaniards, Asian and Indian workers and have both foreign training schemes and youth apprenticeships.There are 16 apprentices & many female engineers. Every worker must belong to a union and most are members of the "Transport and Genral Workers Union". In 2 years there have been no redundencies. The pistons and piston rings are made of aluminium and cast iron and range in size from the largest comparable to a pedal bin to as small as a tea cup. Approximately 50,000 are produced a week and they are supplied to 16 different countries. The Ampress works were chosen as the site for the research and developement unit in 1961
